1.text: Paul, an Apostle, not from men and not through man, but through Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead,

2.text: and all the brothers who are with me: to the churches of Galatia.

3.text: Grace and peace to you from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.text: who gave himself on behalf of our sins, so that he might deliver us from this present wicked age, according to the will of God our Father.

5.text: To him is glory forever and ever. Amen.

6.text: I wonder that you have been so quickly transferred, from him who called you into the grace of Christ, over to another gospel.

7.text: For there is no other, except that there are some persons who disturb you and who want to overturn the Gospel of Christ.

8.text: But if anyone, even we ourselves or an Angel from Heaven, were to preach to you a gospel other than the one that we have preached to you, let him be anathema.

9.text: Just as we have said before, so now I say again: If anyone has preached a gospel to you, other than that which you have received, let him be anathema.

10.text: For am I now persuading men, or God? Or, am I seeking to please men? If I still were pleasing men, then I would not be a servant of Christ.

11.text: For I would have you understand, brothers, that the Gospel which has been preached by me is not according to man.

12.text: And I did not receive it from man, nor did I learn it, except through the revelation of Jesus Christ.

13.text: For you have heard of my former behavior within Judaism: that, beyond measure, I persecuted the Church of God and fought against Her.

14.text: And I advanced in Judaism beyond many of my equals among my own kind, having proven to be more abundant in zeal toward the traditions of my fathers.

15.text: But, when it pleased him who, from my mother’s womb, had set me apart, and who has called me by his grace,

16.text: to reveal his Son within me, so that I might evangelize him among the Gentiles, I did not next seek the consent of flesh and blood.

17.text: Neither did I go to Jerusalem, to those who were Apostles before me. Instead, I went into Arabia, and next I returned to Damascus.

18.text: And then, after three years, I went to Jerusalem to see Peter; and I stayed with him for fifteen days.

19.text: But I saw none of the other Apostles, except James, the brother of the Lord.

20.text: Now what I am writing to you: behold, before God, I am not lying.

21.text: Next, I went into the regions of Syria and Cilicia.

22.text: But I was unknown by face to the churches of Judea, which were in Christ.

23.text: For they had only heard that: “He, who formerly persecuted us, now evangelizes the faith which he once fought.”

24.text: And they glorified God in me.
